metadata.description:
The data set contains meteorological element observation data of huazhaizi desert station in the middle reaches of heihe hydrological meteorological observation network from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2017.The station is located in huazhaizi, zhangye city, gansu province.The latitude and longitude of huazhaizi station is 100.3201E, 38.7659N and 1731m above sea level.The observation items include: air temperature and relative humidity sensors at 5m and 10m, facing due north;Install the barometer inside the waterproof box;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed and direction sensor is set at 5m and 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm of the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water sensor is buried 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil hot plates (3 pieces) are buried 6cm underground.Specific observation elements are as follows:
Air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m RH_5m Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage), and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: Celsius).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data elements of observation data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;From November to December 2017, due to wiring problems, there were discontinuous errors in long-wave radiation;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2017-6-10:10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al. (2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).

该数据集包含了2017年1月1日至2017年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游花寨子荒漠站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市花寨子，下垫面是盐爪爪山前荒漠。花寨子站的经纬度为100.3201E, 38.7659N，海拔1731m。观测项目包括：空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速风向传感器架设在5m、10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。具体观测要素如下：
空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保观测数据要素每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；2017.11-12月由于接线问题，长波辐射出现间断错误；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2017-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈平流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。在这封信中，显示出与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量与观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）比率进行了更好的验证。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估计蒸散（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

衍生组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在离地4.5米处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热成像相机获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，将模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验（Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces）中的蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）的比率，这项实验是黑河水联合遥测实验研究（Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research，HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强对流条件下，TSEB模型也能产生可靠的E/ET%和T/ET%比率及ET的估计。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，潜热通量的平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括HRB的中下游，位于中国西部的干旱地区，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站点——2个超级站和9个普通站。本文报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when estimating surface fluxes in irrigated agricultural areas, and how is it addressed in research observations?

Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in estimating surface fluxes in irrigated agricultural areas is the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to available energy. This is addressed by using the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, which accounts for the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences and incorporates ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures to improve the accuracy of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates.
Example.AnswerCn: 在估算灌溉农业区的表面通量时，一个挑战是能量平衡闭合的不完整性。为了解决这个问题，采用了双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，该模型考虑了表面与空气温度差异的不确定性，并结合地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，以提高蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发估算的准确性。

Feature Specification.AnswerEn: high-resolution thermal camera measurements, soil and canopy component temperature calculations, classifying image pixels into soil and canopy categories, converting thermal infrared temperatures to radiation temperatures, incoming long-wave radiation, emissivity data
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热成像仪测量、土壤和冠层成分温度计算、将图像像素分类为土壤和冠层类别、将热红外温度转换为辐射温度、入射长波辐射、发射率数据。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key attributes of data processing and quality control procedures for long-term flux datasets in oasis–desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，长期通量数据集的数据处理和质量控制程序的关键属性是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: half-hourly turbulent flux data, eddy covariance system, scintillometer, hydrometeorological data, 10-minute average period
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 半小时湍流通量数据，涡度相关系统，闪烁仪，水文气象数据，10分钟平均周期

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'four-component radiometer' refer to in meteorological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: “四分量辐射计”在气象数据收集中指的是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: A four-component radiometer in meteorological data collection refers to an instrument used to measure four key components of radiation: direct and diffuse solar radiation, as well as upward and downward longwave radiation. This information is crucial for understanding the energy balance at the Earth's surface, which is essential for calculating surface fluxes such as evapotranspiration.
Definition.AnswerCn: 四分量辐射计在气象数据收集中的作用是测量辐射的四个关键组成部分：直接和散射太阳辐射，以及向上和向下的长波辐射。这些信息对于理解地表的能量平衡至关重要，这对于计算表面通量（如蒸散发）是必不可少的。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data quality control and processing techniques between a dataset collected from the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 and one from the oasis–desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验收集的数据集与绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集在数据质量控制和处理技术方面有哪些差异？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The 黑河生态水文遥感试验 dataset includes quality control measures such as marking missing data with a specific value, removing duplicate records, and deleting data outside physical ranges. The oasis–desert systems dataset involves a structured data processing and quality control procedure split into data collection, processing, and archiving, emphasizing the use of auxiliary data to supplement the flux measurements.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验数据集包括质量控制措施，例如用特定值标记缺失数据、删除重复记录以及删除超出物理范围的数据。绿洲-沙漠系统数据集涉及一个结构化的数据处理和质量控制程序，分为数据收集、处理和归档，强调使用辅助数据来补充通量测量。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the integration of remote sensing and ground-based observations enhance the interpretation of hydrological and meteorological patterns in arid and semi-arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 遥感技术与地面观测的结合如何增强对干旱和半干旱地区水文和气象模式的解读？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing with ground-based observations allows for a comprehensive analysis of hydrological and meteorological patterns by providing spatial and temporal data coverage. This combination enhances the understanding of complex interactions between soil and vegetation in heterogeneous landscapes and supports the validation of models and measurements, especially in areas with limited accessibility.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 将遥感与地面观测相结合，可以通过提供空间和时间数据覆盖，全面分析水文和气象模式。这种结合增强了对异质景观中土壤和植被之间复杂相互作用的理解，并支持模型和测量的验证，特别是在可达性有限的地区。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodologies could be employed to improve the accuracy of estimating energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以采用哪些方法来提高对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的估计准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Methodologies such as the use of high-resolution thermal cameras for temperature measurements, application of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, and validation using stable isotopes and eddy covariance systems can improve accuracy. Additionally, the classification of thermal images into soil and canopy pixels and the consideration of atmospheric conditions can refine component temperature and flux estimations.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪进行温度测量、应用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，以及利用稳定同位素和涡度协方差系统进行验证的方法，可以提高准确性。此外，将热图像分类为土壤和树冠像素，并考虑大气条件，可以进一步精确组件温度和通量估算。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges of accurately capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange measurements in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，准确捕捉能量、水蒸气和碳交换测量的挑战因素包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation challenges such as drying rivers, vegetation degradation, desertification, and dust storms, which complicate accurate measurement of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化的挑战，如河流干涸、植被退化、沙漠化和沙尘暴，这使得能量、水汽和碳交换的准确测量变得复杂。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why might data collection techniques used in the Heihe River Basin encounter difficulties in ensuring data quality and consistency?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域使用的数据收集技术可能在确保数据质量和一致性方面遇到困难的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Data collection methods using automatic weather stations and eddy covariance systems may face difficulties due to environmental factors such as strong advective conditions, image classification errors, and the complex ecological interactions in oasis–desert systems.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用自动气象站和涡度协方差系统的数据收集方法可能会面临环境因素的挑战，例如强烈的平流条件、图像分类错误以及绿洲-沙漠系统中的复杂生态相互作用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What underlying causes might lead to errors in estimating soil and canopy temperatures using thermal infrared cameras in agricultural regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在农业地区使用热红外相机估计土壤和冠层温度时，可能导致错误的潜在原因有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors may arise from image classification mistakes, atmospheric radiation influences, and uncertainties in radiation transmittance through the canopy, which can affect the accuracy of soil and canopy temperature estimations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 错误可能源于图像分类错误、大气辐射影响以及通过树冠的辐射透过率的不确定性，这些都可能影响土壤和树冠温度估计的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using long-term observational datasets in understanding oasis–desert interactions and supporting sustainable development?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用长期观测数据集来理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用以及支持可持续发展的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using long-term observational datasets allows for a comprehensive understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert interactions. This understanding is crucial for achieving sustainable development goals, as it provides insights into maintaining ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic development. Such datasets enable researchers to monitor changes over time, assess the impacts of climate change, and devise strategies for ecological conservation and resource management.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用长期观测数据集可以全面了解绿洲-沙漠相互作用中的能量、水汽和碳交换。这种理解对于实现可持续发展目标至关重要，因为它提供了维持生态稳定和支持社会经济发展的见解。这些数据集使研究人员能够监测随时间变化的情况，评估气候变化的影响，并制定生态保护和资源管理的策略。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems when developing datasets for studying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在开发用于研究能量、水汽和碳交换的数据集时，保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡是重要的。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems to achieve sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these ecosystems is important for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality and supporting the ecological security and sustainable development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。了解这些生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the objective of collecting long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert systems, particularly concerning energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集长期观测数据集的目标，特别是关于能量、水蒸气和碳通量的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective of collecting long-term observational datasets is to gain a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas. This understanding is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and is significant for protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 收集长期观测数据集的目的是为了定量理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to have a detailed understanding of soil and canopy component temperatures for datasets aiming to partition evapotranspiration in strongly advective environments?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流环境中，详细了解土壤和冠层组分温度对于旨在划分蒸散发的数据集是必要的。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: A detailed understanding of soil and canopy component temperatures is necessary because accurate separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures is crucial for estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration. This is especially important in strongly advective environments where errors in component temperature can significantly affect the performance of models like the TSEB model.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 对土壤和冠层成分温度的详细理解是必要的，因为准确分离土壤和植被成分温度对于估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发至关重要。这在强烈的平流环境中尤其重要，因为成分温度的错误可能会显著影响像TSEB模型这样的模型的性能。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in ensuring the quality control and preprocessing of hydrometeorological data collected from an observational network in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保来自干旱地区观测网络收集的水文气象数据质量控制和预处理的程序包括哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data collection involves ensuring 144 data points per day with each representing a 10-minute interval. If data is missing, it is marked as -6999. Quality control includes removing duplicate records, deleting data that is physically meaningless or exceeds instrument range, and marking questionable data in red. The date and time are formatted uniformly in the dataset.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据收集涉及确保每天收集144个数据点，每个数据点代表一个10分钟的时间间隔。如果数据缺失，则标记为-6999。质量控制包括删除重复记录，删除物理上无意义或超出仪器范围的数据，并将可疑数据标记为红色。数据集中的日期和时间格式统一。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can ground-based thermal imaging be integrated with existing meteorological data to accurately estimate evapotranspiration components in a heterogeneous landscape?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何将地面热成像与现有气象数据结合，以准确估计异质景观中的蒸散发成分？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Ground-based thermal imaging can be integrated by using high-resolution thermal cameras to capture soil and canopy temperatures. These temperatures are then used as inputs in models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration components. The thermal images are classified into soil and canopy pixels, and the temperatures are converted to radiometric temperatures using long-wave radiation data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 地面热成像可以通过使用高分辨率热像仪来捕捉土壤和树冠温度进行集成。这些温度随后作为输入用于像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型这样的模型，以将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾两个组成部分。热图像被分类为土壤像素和树冠像素，温度则通过长波辐射数据转换为辐射温度。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What steps are necessary to collect and process long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集和处理长期能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据所需的步骤包括：

1. 确定研究区域：选择具有代表性的绿洲-沙漠生态系统的地点。
2. 设备选择与安装：选择合适的传感器和仪器（如涡度协方差系统、气象站等），并在研究区域内进行安装。
3. 数据收集：定期收集能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据，确保数据的连续性和一致性。
4. 数据质量控制：对收集的数据进行质量检查，剔除异常值和错误数据。
5. 数据处理与分析：使用适当的统计和模型分析方法处理数据，提取有用的信息。
6. 结果验证：通过与其他研究或数据源进行比较，验证结果的准确性。
7. 数据存储与共享：将处理后的数据存储在数据库中，并根据需要与其他研究人员共享。
8. 持续监测与评估：定期评估监测系统的有效性，并根据需要进行调整和改进。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The collection involves using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers to acquire turbulent flux data, complemented by automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data. The data is collected with a focus on radiation, soil heat flux, temperature, humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Data processing includes steps for data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing, ensuring quality control throughout these processes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该收集工作涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据，并辅以自动气象站获取水文气象数据。数据收集重点关注辐射、土壤热通量、温度、湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。数据处理包括数据收集、处理、归档和共享的步骤，确保在这些过程中进行质量控制。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements or data collection methods enable the accurate measurement of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步或数据收集方法能够准确测量绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data, along with automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data collection, enables the accurate measurement of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems. These systems provide comprehensive datasets, including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles, which are crucial for understanding these exchanges.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据，以及自动气象站进行水文气象数据收集，使得在绿洲-沙漠系统中准确测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换成为可能。这些系统提供了全面的数据集，包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面，这些数据对于理解这些交换至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do the conditions in arid and semiarid regions enable or challenge the collection of long-term ecological data?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 干旱和半干旱地区的条件如何促进或挑战长期生态数据的收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Arid and semiarid regions present challenges such as ecological degradation, drying of water bodies, and land desertification, which can impede long-term data collection. However, these conditions also necessitate comprehensive monitoring, enabling the collection of extensive datasets that include energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, as well as hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters to understand the interactions in oasis–desert systems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化、水体干涸和土地沙漠化等挑战，这些问题可能妨碍长期数据收集。然而，这些条件也要求进行全面监测，从而能够收集包括能量、水汽和碳通量，以及水文气象、植被和土壤参数在内的广泛数据集，以理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的相互作用。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways does the integration of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes with thermal imaging enable improved validation of evapotranspiration estimates?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素与热成像的结合如何提高蒸散发估算的验证效果？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques with high-resolution thermal imaging enables improved validation of evapotranspiration estimates by providing more accurate soil and canopy component temperatures. This approach allows for better partitioning of evaporation and transpiration components, enhancing the validation of evapotranspiration ratios and estimates using the TSEB model, even in strongly advective conditions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素技术与高分辨率热成像的结合，能够通过提供更准确的土壤和冠层组分温度，改善蒸散发估算的验证。这种方法允许更好地划分蒸发和蒸腾组分，从而增强在强烈的平流条件下使用TSEB模型对蒸散发比率和估算的验证。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in achieving accurate separation of soil and canopy temperatures in arid regions using current data collection methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，使用当前的数据收集方法实现土壤和冠层温度的准确分离可能面临挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions due to factors such as image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance, and the potential for soil pixels to be mistakenly classified as vegetation pixels. This can lead to overestimations of canopy temperature and inaccuracies in the data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性受到限制，原因包括图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，以及土壤像素可能被错误分类为植被像素。这可能导致对树冠温度的高估和数据的不准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What might be the reasons for discrepancies in energy balance closure when using eddy covariance systems in strongly advective environments?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强对流环境中使用涡度协方差系统时，能量平衡闭合存在差异的原因可能是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Discrepancies in energy balance closure with eddy covariance systems can result from the strong advective environment, which affects the accuracy of measurements. The uncertainties in surface-air temperature difference and errors in determining soil and vegetation component temperatures contribute to these discrepancies.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统中能量平衡闭合的差异可能源于强烈的平流环境，这会影响测量的准确性。地表与空气温度差的测量不确定性以及土壤和植被组分温度确定中的误差都对这些差异产生了影响。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it crucial to have long-term observational datasets for studying oasis–desert interactions in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在研究干旱地区绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用时，拥有长期观测数据集是至关重要的。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are crucial for studying oasis–desert interactions because they provide a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. These datasets are essential for recognizing oasis–desert interactions, supporting ecological stability, and ensuring sustainable socio-economic development in arid regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于研究绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，因为它们提供了能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解。这些数据集对于识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用、支持生态稳定以及确保干旱地区的可持续社会经济发展是必不可少的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the data collection techniques used in the oasis–desert systems for capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在绿洲-沙漠系统中用于捕获能量、水汽和碳交换的数据收集技术的评估是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques in the oasis–desert systems involve long-term observational datasets capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon and methane fluxes. These datasets are supplemented with hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, employing instruments like eddy covariance systems and scintillometers. This comprehensive approach is crucial for understanding the interactions within oasis–desert ecosystems and supports ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，数据收集技术涉及长期观测数据集，捕捉能量、水蒸气以及碳和甲烷的通量。这些数据集辅以水文气象、植被和土壤参数，采用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪等仪器。这种综合方法对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统内的相互作用至关重要，并支持生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you perceive the challenges faced in accurately separating soil and canopy component temperatures using thermal infrared cameras in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何看待在干旱地区使用热红外相机准确分离土壤和冠层组分温度所面临的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in accurately separating soil and canopy component temperatures using thermal infrared cameras in arid regions include errors caused by image classification, particularly under varying vegetation abundance. Misclassification can lead to overestimation of canopy temperatures, impacting model performance. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce uncertainties in temperature estimation, making accurate separation challenging.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，使用热红外相机准确分离土壤和冠层组件温度面临的挑战包括由于图像分类引起的误差，特别是在植被丰度变化的情况下。错误分类可能导致冠层温度的高估，从而影响模型性能。此外，忽视大气向上辐射和透射率可能会引入温度估计的不确定性，使得准确分离变得更加困难。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your judgment on the potential for refining datasets to improve evapotranspiration estimation models over heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在异质景观中精炼数据集以改善蒸散发估计模型的潜力的判断是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Refining datasets for improved evapotranspiration estimation models over heterogeneous landscapes is promising. Utilizing ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, combined with stable isotope techniques and eddy covariance measurements, can enhance model validation. The potential for refining datasets lies in addressing uncertainties and improving component temperature calculations, which are crucial for separating evapotranspiration components accurately.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 改进异质景观上蒸散发估算模型的数据集是有前景的。利用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，结合稳定同位素技术和涡度协方差测量，可以增强模型验证。改进数据集的潜力在于解决不确定性和改善组分温度计算，这对于准确分离蒸散发组分至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection for energy fluxes in oasis–desert systems can be accurately maintained over a long-term period.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在绿洲-沙漠系统中，如何能够准确地维持长期的数据收集以获取能量通量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Long-term data collection in oasis–desert systems is achieved using a suite of observational datasets that include energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes. Data is collected using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, supplemented with hydrometeorological data from automatic weather stations that record parameters like radiation, soil heat flux, and various atmospheric conditions every 10 minutes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，长期数据收集是通过一系列观测数据集实现的，这些数据集包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量。数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪收集，并辅以自动气象站的水文气象数据，这些站每10分钟记录一次辐射、土壤热通量和各种大气条件等参数。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the soil and canopy component temperatures are separated in data processing for evapotranspiration studies.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在蒸散发研究中，土壤和冠层组件温度是如何在数据处理过程中分开的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In evapotranspiration studies, soil and canopy component temperatures are separated using images from a thermal infrared camera. These images are classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method, and the temperatures are derived by accounting for incoming long-wave radiation and emissivities to obtain radiometric temperatures.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在蒸散发研究中，使用热红外相机的图像将土壤和冠层组件的温度分开。这些图像通过最大似然法分类为土壤像素和冠层像素，并通过考虑入射长波辐射和发射率来获得辐射温度。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the data collection methods used for obtaining hydrometeorological data in oasis-desert ecosystems, particularly those involving instrumentation and measurement intervals.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨用于获取绿洲-沙漠生态系统水文气象数据的数据收集方法，特别是涉及仪器和测量间隔的方面。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for hydrometeorological data in oasis-desert ecosystems involve using automatic weather stations that record various parameters every 10 minutes. These parameters include radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Additionally, eddy covariance systems and scintillometers are used for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，水文气象数据的收集方法涉及使用自动气象站，每10分钟记录各种参数。这些参数包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。此外，还使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪来获取半小时的湍流通量数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in accurately measuring evapotranspiration components in heterogeneous land surfaces, especially in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在异质土地表面，特别是在干旱地区，准确测量蒸散发组成部分所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in measuring evapotranspiration components in arid regions include the difficulty in ground measurement of evaporation and transpiration, the limitation of composite temperature separation approaches, and classification errors in image processing that can lead to inaccurate component temperature estimation. These errors can result from vegetation abundance variations, atmospheric conditions, and uncertainties in radiation transmittance through the canopy.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，测量蒸散发组成部分的挑战包括地面测量蒸发和蒸腾的困难、复合温度分离方法的局限性，以及图像处理中的分类错误，这可能导致组成部分温度估计不准确。这些错误可能源于植被丰度变化、大气条件以及通过冠层的辐射透过率的不确定性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate potential datasets that support long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis-desert systems and their availability for research purposes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查支持绿洲-沙漠系统中长期能量、水汽和碳交换观测的潜在数据集及其研究用途的可用性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis-desert systems include those from the middle and lower reaches of the HRB in western China. Since 2012, a network of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations has been established, providing data on energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological parameters, and vegetation and soil characteristics. These datasets are freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的长期能源、水汽和碳交换观测数据集包括来自中国西部黄河中下游地区的数据。从2012年起，建立了一个由11个地表通量和气象站组成的网络，提供关于能量、水汽、碳通量、气象水文参数以及植被和土壤特征的数据。这些数据集可以从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。
